content: asali socks top-down socks with a honeycomb cable pattern along the front featuring serendipitous wool co © dawn henderson page �1 of �8 @dawn landix // dlyn1124@gmail com asali socks sizes 1 2 3 4 finished sock circumference of 7 8 9 10 in / 18 20 23 25 cm recommended to be worn with 0-0 5 in 0-1 27 cm negative ease shown in size 2 yarn 1 skein serendipitous wool company vayu fingering 75% superwash merino 25% nylon 436 yards / 420 meters 4 oz or approx 300-450 yards/ 274-411 meters fingering weight yarn sample is knit in the golden earth colorway needles 2 25 mm / us 1 or needle size to obtain gauge 2 75 mm / us 2 or needle size to obtain gauge this pattern is written for the magic loop technique but can easily be worked using other preferred circular methods gauge 32 sts x 32 rounds = 4 x 4 in / 10 x 10 cm honeycomb cable pattern in the round post-blocking on larger needles materials blocking tools cable needle optional darning needle stitch marker tape measure © dawn henderson page �2 of �8 @dawn landix // dlyn1124@gmail com asali socks abbreviations 1/1 lc slip 1 stitch to cable needle sl slip purlwise with yarn in and hold in front knit 1 back unless otherwise then knit 1 from cable indicated needle ssk slip 1 stitch knitwise slip 1 1/1 rc slip 1 stitch to cable stitch knitwise knit two needle and hold in back stitches together through knit 1 then knit 1 from back loop 1 stitch cable needle decreased co cast on st s stitch es decrease decrease d s ing wyif with yarn if front k knit k1tbl knit 1 stitch through back loop k2tog knit 2 stitches together 1 stitch decreased p purl p2tog purl two stitches together 1 stitch decreased patt pattern pm place marker rem remain s ing © dawn henderson page �3 of �8 @dawn landix // dlyn1124@gmail com asali socks © dawn henderson page �4 of �8 @dawn landix // dlyn1124@gmail com asali socks the asali socks are a timeless design heel flap featuring a panel of honeycomb cables row 1 rs sl1 k1 across going down the front of each sock and 2x2 ribbing along the back the socks are row 2 ws sl1 wyif purl across worked from the top-down and include heel flap and gusset construction with a repeat row 1 and 2 for 28 32 36 40 total rounded heel and a slightly rounded toe row there are now 14 16 18 20 slipped the cable panel is charted and the simple sts along the edge of the heel flap end on 1x1 cables are easily worked without a ws row cable needle heel turn directions row 1 rs sl1 k 15 17 19 21 sts ssk k1 turn cuff with smaller needles co 56 64 72 80 row 2 ws sl1 wyif p5 p2tog p1 turn sts using
